#!/usr/bin/env python3 """ üöÄ Professional Email Deliverability Processor 2025 Legitimate email optimization system focused on sender reputation and deliverability Based on current Gmail, Outlook, and Yahoo spam filter research """ import re import hashlib import string from typing import List, Dict, Optional, Tuple from datetime import datetime, timedelta import uuid import random class ProfessionalEmailProcessor: """Professional email processor using legitimate deliverability techniques for 2025""" def __init__(self): # Modern spam triggers that actually matter in 2025 self.high_risk_words = [ 'urgent', 'limited time', 'act now', 'click here', 'free money', 'guaranteed', 'no risk', 'winner', 'congratulations', 'urgent response', 'verify account', 'suspended account', 'confirm identity', 'make money fast', '100% free', 'cash bonus', 'risk free' ] # Content quality indicators self.professional_indicators = [ 'newsletter', 'update', 'information', 'announcement', 'insight', 'report', 'analysis', 'summary', 'overview', 'guide' ] # Email authentication requirements for 2025 self.required_headers = { 'authentication': ['SPF', 'DKIM', 'DMARC'], 'reputation': ['Message-ID', 'Return-Path', 'List-Unsubscribe'], 'compliance': ['Physical-Address', 'Unsubscribe-Link'] } def analyze_content_quality(self, text: str) -> Dict[str, any]: """Analyze email content for spam indicators and quality metrics""" words = text.lower().split() total_words = len(words) # Count spam triggers spam_score = 0 for trigger in self.high_risk_words: if trigger.lower() in text.lower(): spam_score += 1 # Count professional indicators professional_score = 0 for indicator in self.professional_indicators: if indicator.lower() in text.lower(): professional_score += 1 # Calculate ratios spam_ratio = spam_score / max(total_words / 10, 1) # Per 10 words caps_ratio = sum(1 for char in text if char.isupper()) / max(len(text), 1) exclamation_count = text.count('!') return { 'total_words': total_words, 'spam_score': spam_score, 'professional_score': professional_score, 'spam_ratio': spam_ratio, 'caps_ratio': caps_ratio, 'exclamation_count': exclamation_count, 'quality_grade': self._calculate_quality_grade(spam_ratio, caps_ratio, exclamation_count) } def _calculate_quality_grade(self, spam_ratio: float, caps_ratio: float, exclamation_count: int) -> str: """Calculate overall content quality grade""" if spam_ratio > 0.3 or caps_ratio > 0.3 or exclamation_count > 5: return 'HIGH_RISK' elif spam_ratio > 0.1 or caps_ratio > 0.1 or exclamation_count > 2: return 'MEDIUM_RISK' else: return 'LOW_RISK' def improve_content_quality(self, text: str) -> str: """Improve content quality by replacing problematic patterns""" # Replace obvious spam patterns with professional alternatives replacements = { 'CLICK HERE': 'Learn more', 'ACT NOW': 'Take action', 'LIMITED TIME': 'Available now', 'FREE MONEY': 'Complimentary offer', 'URGENT': 'Important', '!!!': '.', 'GUARANTEED': 'Likely', } result = text for old, new in replacements.items(): result = re.sub(old, new, result, flags=re.IGNORECASE) return result def validate_links(self, html: str) -> Dict[str, any]: """Validate and analyze links for reputation impact""" # Extract all links link_pattern = r']+)["\'][^>]*>([^<]*)' links = re.findall(link_pattern, html, re.IGNORECASE) link_analysis = { 'total_links': len(links), 'suspicious_links': 0, 'short_links': 0, 'legitimate_domains': 0, 'recommendations': [] } suspicious_patterns = ['bit.ly', 'tinyurl', 'shortened', 'redirect', 'click'] legitimate_tlds = ['.com', '.org', '.gov', '.edu', '.net'] for href, text in links: # Check for suspicious patterns if any(pattern in href.lower() for pattern in suspicious_patterns): link_analysis['suspicious_links'] += 1 link_analysis['recommendations'].append(f"Use full URLs instead of: {href}") # Check for legitimate domains if any(tld in href.lower() for tld in legitimate_tlds): link_analysis['legitimate_domains'] += 1 # Check link text quality if text.lower() in ['click here', 'click now', 'urgent']: link_analysis['recommendations'].append(f"Replace '{text}' with descriptive text") return link_analysis def optimize_links(self, html: str) -> str: """Optimize links for better deliverability""" # Replace problematic link texts link_text_replacements = { 'click here': 'learn more', 'click now': 'view details', 'urgent': 'important information', 'act now': 'take action' } def improve_link(match): href = match.group(1) text = match.group(2) # Improve link text improved_text = text for old, new in link_text_replacements.items(): if old.lower() in text.lower(): improved_text = re.sub(old, new, improved_text, flags=re.IGNORECASE) return f'{improved_text}' pattern = r']+)["\'][^>]*>([^<]*)' return re.sub(pattern, improve_link, html, flags=re.IGNORECASE) def generate_authentication_headers(self, sender_email: str, domain: str) -> Dict[str, str]: """Generate proper email authentication headers for 2025 compliance""" message_id = f"<{uuid.uuid4().hex}@{domain}>" headers = { 'Message-ID': message_id, 'Date': datetime.now().strftime('%a, %d %b %Y %H:%M:%S +0000'), 'From': sender_email, 'Return-Path': f"<{sender_email}>", 'List-Unsubscribe': f", ", 'List-Unsubscribe-Post': 'List-Unsubscribe=One-Click', 'X-Mailer': 'Professional Email System', 'MIME-Version': '1.0', 'Content-Type': 'text/html; charset=UTF-8' } return headers def add_authentication_guidance(self, domain: str) -> Dict[str, str]: """Provide SPF, DKIM, DMARC setup guidance""" return { 'SPF': f'v=spf1 include:_spf.{domain} ~all', 'DKIM': f'DKIM-Signature: v=1; a=rsa-sha256; d={domain}; s=selector1; c=relaxed/relaxed;', 'DMARC': f'v=DMARC1; p=none; rua=mailto:dmarc-reports@{domain}; ruf=mailto:dmarc-failures@{domain}; sp=none; aspf=r;', 'setup_instructions': { 'SPF': 'Add TXT record: v=spf1 include:your-mail-server.com ~all', 'DKIM': 'Generate 2048-bit key pair, add public key to DNS TXT record', 'DMARC': 'Start with p=none, monitor reports, gradually move to p=quarantine then p=reject' } } def add_professional_structure(self, html_content: str, sender_info: Dict) -> str: """Add professional email structure with proper meta tags""" # Modern email client meta tags meta_tags = ''' ''' # Insert meta tags if '' in html_content: html_content = html_content.replace('', f'\n{meta_tags}\n') else: html_content = f'\n{meta_tags}\n\n' + html_content return html_content def add_compliance_footer(self, html_content: str, sender_info: Dict) -> str: """Add CAN-SPAM and GDPR compliant footer""" company = sender_info.get('company', 'Your Company') address = sender_info.get('address', '123 Business St, City, ST 12345') unsubscribe_url = sender_info.get('unsubscribe_url', '#') # Professional footer with legal compliance footer = f'''\n

This email was sent by {company}

{address}

Unsubscribe | Update Preferences | Privacy Policy

¬© {datetime.now().year} {company}. All rights reserved.
\n''' # Insert before closing body tag if '' in html_content: html_content = html_content.replace('', footer + '') else: html_content += footer return html_content def process_email(self, html_content: str, sender_info: Dict) -> Dict[str, any]: """Main processing function using legitimate deliverability techniques for 2025""" print("üöÄ PROFESSIONAL EMAIL DELIVERABILITY PROCESSING ACTIVATED!") results = {'original_content': html_content, 'warnings': [], 'recommendations': []} # Step 1: Analyze content quality print("üìä Analyzing content quality...") text_content = re.sub('<[^<]+?>', '', html_content) # Strip HTML for analysis quality_analysis = self.analyze_content_quality(text_content) results['content_analysis'] = quality_analysis if quality_analysis['quality_grade'] == 'HIGH_RISK': results['warnings'].append("Content has high spam risk - consider rewriting") # Step 2: Improve content quality print("‚ú® Optimizing content quality...") improved_content = self.improve_content_quality(html_content) # Step 3: Validate and optimize links print("üîó Analyzing and optimizing links...") link_analysis = self.validate_links(improved_content) results['link_analysis'] = link_analysis optimized_content = self.optimize_links(improved_content) # Step 4: Add professional email structure print("üìß Adding professional email structure...") structured_content = self.add_professional_structure(optimized_content, sender_info) # Step 5: Add compliance footer print("üìù Adding compliance footer...") final_content = self.add_compliance_footer(structured_content, sender_info) # Step 6: Generate authentication guidance domain = sender_info.get('domain', 'example.com') auth_headers = self.generate_authentication_headers(sender_info.get('email', 'noreply@example.com'), domain) auth_guidance = self.add_authentication_guidance(domain) results.update({ 'processed_content': final_content, 'authentication_headers': auth_headers, 'authentication_setup': auth_guidance, 'deliverability_score': self._calculate_deliverability_score(quality_analysis, link_analysis) }) print("‚úÖ PROFESSIONAL EMAIL PROCESSING COMPLETE!") return results def _calculate_deliverability_score(self, content_analysis: Dict, link_analysis: Dict) -> int: """Calculate overall deliverability score out of 100""" score = 100 # Deduct for content issues if content_analysis['quality_grade'] == 'HIGH_RISK': score -= 30 elif content_analysis['quality_grade'] == 'MEDIUM_RISK': score -= 15 # Deduct for link issues if link_analysis['suspicious_links'] > 0: score -= link_analysis['suspicious_links'] * 10 # Cap at reasonable bounds return max(0, min(100, score)) def get_deliverability_report(self, results: Dict) -> str: """Generate a comprehensive deliverability report""" score = results.get('deliverability_score', 0) report = f""" üéØ DELIVERABILITY REPORT {'='*50} Overall Score: {score}/100 Content Analysis: - Total Words: {results['content_analysis']['total_words']} - Quality Grade: {results['content_analysis']['quality_grade']} - Spam Triggers Found: {results['content_analysis']['spam_score']} - Professional Indicators: {results['content_analysis']['professional_score']} Link Analysis: - Total Links: {results['link_analysis']['total_links']} - Suspicious Links: {results['link_analysis']['suspicious_links']} - Legitimate Domains: {results['link_analysis']['legitimate_domains']} Authentication Setup Required: - SPF: {results['authentication_setup']['SPF']} - DMARC: {results['authentication_setup']['DMARC']} Recommendations: """ for rec in results.get('recommendations', []): report += f"- {rec}\n" for rec in results['link_analysis'].get('recommendations', []): report += f"- {rec}\n" return report def get_warming_schedule(self, target_daily_volume: int) -> Dict[str, any]: """Generate domain/IP warming schedule for gradual volume increase""" weeks = 6 schedule = {} for week in range(1, weeks + 1): daily_volume = min(target_daily_volume, int(target_daily_volume * (week / weeks) * 0.8)) schedule[f'week_{week}'] = { 'daily_volume': daily_volume, 'target_engagement': 'highest_engaged' if week <= 2 else 'all_engaged' if week <= 4 else 'all_subscribers', 'recommendations': [ 'Monitor bounce rates (keep under 2%)', 'Watch spam complaint rates (keep under 0.1%)', 'Track engagement rates (opens/clicks)', 'Use consistent sending schedule' ] } return { 'total_weeks': weeks, 'target_volume': target_daily_volume, 'schedule': schedule, 'critical_metrics': [ 'Bounce rate < 2%', 'Spam complaints < 0.1%', 'Consistent daily sending', 'High engagement rates' ] } # Example usage and testing functions def main(): """Example usage of the Professional Email Processor""" processor = ProfessionalEmailProcessor() # Sample problematic HTML email (typical spam patterns) sample_html = ''' URGENT: Free Money Opportunity!

FREE MONEY OPPORTUNITY!!!

CLICK HERE for a LIMITED TIME offer to earn money fast!

CLICK FOR FREE MONEY NOW!

This URGENT offer expires soon. ACT NOW for GUARANTEED results!

Best investment opportunity with NO RISK!

Click here
''' # Sender information sender_info = { 'email': 'newsletter@mycompany.com', 'domain': 'mycompany.com', 'company': 'My Professional Company', 'address': '123 Business Avenue, Professional City, PC 12345', 'unsubscribe_url': 'https://mycompany.com/unsubscribe', 'preferences_url': 'https://mycompany.com/preferences', 'privacy_url': 'https://mycompany.com/privacy' } print("BEFORE PROCESSING:") print("-" * 70) print(sample_html) print("\n") # Process the HTML results = processor.process_email(sample_html, sender_info) print("\nPROCESSING RESULTS:") print("-" * 70) print(processor.get_deliverability_report(results)) # Save processed HTML with open('professional_email.html', 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(results['processed_content']) print(f"\nüíæ Processed HTML saved to 'professional_email.html'") # Show authentication setup print("\nüîí REQUIRED DNS RECORDS:") print("-" * 40) for record_type, value in results['authentication_setup'].items(): if record_type != 'setup_instructions': print(f"{record_type}: {value}") # Show warming schedule print("\nüìà DOMAIN WARMING SCHEDULE:") print("-" * 40) warming = processor.get_warming_schedule(10000) for week, details in warming['schedule'].items(): print(f"{week.replace('_', ' ').title()}: {details['daily_volume']} emails/day") def process_file(input_file: str, output_file: str, sender_info: Dict = None): """Process an HTML file with professional deliverability techniques""" processor = ProfessionalEmailProcessor() if not sender_info: sender_info = { 'email': 'noreply@example.com', 'domain': 'example.com', 'company': 'Example Company', 'address': '123 Example St, Example City, EX 12345' } try: with open(input_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() results = processor.process_email(html_content, sender_info) # Save processed HTML with open(output_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(results['processed_content']) # Save deliverability report report_file = output_file.replace('.html', '_report.txt') with open(report_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(processor.get_deliverability_report(results)) print(f"‚úÖ Successfully processed {input_file} -> {output_file}") print(f"üìä Deliverability report saved to {report_file}") print(f"üéØ Deliverability Score: {results['deliverability_score']}/100") except FileNotFoundError: print(f"‚ùå File {input_file} not found") except Exception as e: print(f"‚ùå Error processing file: {e}") if __name__ == "__main__": import sys if len(sys.argv) == 1: # Run example main() elif len(sys.argv) == 3: # Process specific file input_file, output_file = sys.argv[1], sys.argv[2] process_file(input_file, output_file) elif len(sys.argv) >= 4: # Process with sender info input_file, output_file = sys.argv[1], sys.argv[2] sender_info = { 'email': sys.argv[3] if len(sys.argv) > 3 else 'noreply@example.com', 'domain': sys.argv[3].split('@')[1] if len(sys.argv) > 3 else 'example.com', 'company': sys.argv[4] if len(sys.argv) > 4 else 'Example Company', 'address': sys.argv[5] if len(sys.argv) > 5 else '123 Example St, Example City, EX 12345' } process_file(input_file, output_file, sender_info) else: print("Usage:") print(" python professional_email_processor.py # Run example") print(" python professional_email_processor.py input.html output.html # Process file") print(" python professional_email_processor.py input.html output.html email@domain.com 'Company Name' 'Address' # Full info")
